description.narrative: FEFA is an NGO mainly focusing on: 1, reformed and strengthened legal, institutional, infrasturcture and implementation mechanisms for free and fair elections. 2. increased transparency in parliament,timely analyzed data on legislative proceedings and enhanced accountability of MPs, and increased transparency of the electoral process. 3. increased women & youth political participation

Strengthening democratic principles in Afghanistan - particularly enhancing the credibility and transparency of the electoral process - is a crucial and fundamental to the future of Afghanistan. While the country is dealing with increased insecurity and political challenges, it brings more responsibility to the Afghan government, and civil society to maximize efforts to prevent the loss of decade-long achievements in the fields of women's rights, youth political participation, and good governance. Free & Fair Election Forum of Afghanistan (FEFA) is implemented the second phase of Afghanistan Elections and Democratic Participation Program (ADAPP) during the intial period of 2016-2018, with an extension of the program until June 2020. ADAPP-II is focusing on activities to deepen democratic practices; monitoring of Wolesi Jirga and elections, enhance accountability and transparency in the work of elected bodies (parliament and provincial councils), and citizen’s engagement and accessibility to the reports and information on the work of the parliament together with strengthen democratic participation of women and youth. In sum, FEFA's work rests on three legs: Objective I: Contribute to transparent and inclusive electoral processesObjective II: Strengthening youth and women civic and political Objective III: To promote public knowledge, transparency, and citizen participation in parliamentary processThe program involves partnerships with local organizations and builds on previous initiatives to support meaningful, sustainable channels for citizens to engage in political and electoral processes and in post election activities. In conflict prone situations, active engagement of political and civic actors in the electoral process is the best means to ensure transparency of elections, deter misconduct, and build confidence in the electoral results among voters, candidates, political parties and coalitions. Activities are conducted at the national and sub-national levels through FEFA’s program teams and provincial partners and coordinators.

participating-org.narrative: FEFA/Free and Fair Election Forum of Afghanistan

tag.narrative: 10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The implementation period originally ended at the end of April 2020, and was then extended until end of June in order to complete some final activities. Hence, most of the reported activities took place before Covid 19 (pre mid-March) and a few events have taken place afterwards, including a few sessions on-line. This includes on-line meetings to coordinate advocacy with regards to the peace process, and a Zoom meeting with 50 participants focusing on media's role in elections. However, not all planned activities could be carried out as planned due to the pandemic. This includes awareness seminars planned for universities, which were closed during several months. In other circumstances, meetings were carried out but due to low participation, the purpose of the meeting could not be fulfilled. FEFA requested that awareness seminars at universities could be exchanged for printing material that at a later stage could be shared with university students.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
